name: ARCHETYPE_ID
documentation:
Identifier for archetypes. Ideally these would identify globally unique archetypes.

Lexical form: `rm_originator  '-' rm_name  '-' rm_entity  '.' concept_name {  '-' specialisation }*  '.v' number`.

qualified_rm_entity.name: qualified_rm_entity
qualified_rm_entity.documentation: Globally qualified reference model entity, e.g.  `"openehr-EHR-OBSERVATION"`.

domain_concept.name: domain_concept
domain_concept.documentation: Name of the concept represented by this archetype, including specialisation, e.g. `"Biochemistry_result-cholesterol"`.

rm_originator.name: rm_originator
rm_originator.documentation: Organisation originating the reference model on which this archetype is based, e.g. `"openEHR"`, `"CEN"`, `"HL7"`.

rm_name.name: rm_name
rm_name.documentation: Name of the reference model, e.g. `"RIM"`,  `"EHR"`,  `"EN13606"`.

rm_entity.name: rm_entity
rm_entity.documentation: Name of the ontological level within the reference model to which this archetype is targeted, e.g. for openEHR:  `"FOLDER"`, `"COMPOSITION"`, `"SECTION"`, `"OBSERVATION"`.

specialisation.name: specialisation
specialisation.documentation: Name of specialisation of concept, if this archetype is a specialisation of another archetype, e.g. `"cholesterol"`.
